p: Thakare et al. evaluated the hepatoprotective activity of the methanolic extract of C. hirsutus in albino Wister rats with ethanol-induced hepatotoxicity and the oral administration of the extract at doses of 100, 200 and 400 mg/kg significantly lowered the levels of AST, ALT, ALP, LDH, direct and total bilirubin and cholesterol [ 66].
